title: Network Segmentation
description: Implement proper network segmentation to isolate different types of traffic and reduce attack surface
implementation: Use VLANs, firewalls, and access control lists to segment networks based on function, security requirements, and user groups
examples: Create separate VLANs for servers, workstations, and IoT devices
Use firewall rules to control inter-VLAN traffic

title: Route Summarization
description: Implement route summarization to reduce routing table size and improve network stability
implementation: Group contiguous network addresses and advertise them as a single route to reduce routing overhead
examples: Use area range commands in OSPF

title: Network Monitoring
description: Implement comprehensive network monitoring to detect issues before they impact users
implementation: Deploy monitoring tools to track network performance, availability, and security events
examples: Deploy syslog servers for log collection

title: Configuration Backup
description: Regularly backup network device configurations to ensure quick recovery from failures
implementation: Automate configuration backups and store them securely with version control
examples: Use TFTP or SCP for automated backups
Store backups in secure, redundant locations

title: Quality of Service Implementation
description: Implement QoS policies to ensure critical applications receive appropriate bandwidth and priority
implementation: Define traffic classes, assign priorities, and configure queuing mechanisms based on application requirements
examples: Prioritize VoIP traffic with EF (Expedited Forwarding)

title: Network Redundancy
description: Implement redundant paths and devices to ensure high availability and fault tolerance
implementation: Design networks with multiple paths, redundant devices, and automatic failover mechanisms
examples: Use redundant links with spanning tree
Implement HSRP or VRRP for gateway redundancy

title: Network Documentation
description: Maintain comprehensive network documentation to facilitate troubleshooting and maintenance
implementation: Document network topology, configurations, IP addressing, and operational procedures

title: Access Control
description: Implement strong access control measures to protect network devices and resources
implementation: Use strong authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) mechanisms for network access
examples: Use TACACS+ or RADIUS for authentication
